string.text: This legendary artefact has only ever been found once in the Zone, and was sold to eager scientists for a formidable sum. It offers exceptional protection against radiation, albeit at the cost of other immunities. Anybody planning to use this artefact must be made aware of the severe side effects it imposes

%c[1,1,1,1]______ %c[255,255,255,255]Radiation %c[255,255,1,1]+250
%c[default]
This is an extremely rare and highly radioactive mutation of the Crystal artefact, with a core believed to be to be platinum in its purest form. How this structure functions is unclear, except that you've got two kilos of jewelry grade platinum!
Nicknamed 'The Fighter' due to its protective abilities in combat situations, although sensitivities to burns and electric shock are greatly increased. If you use this artefact ensure that you're carrying the appropriate artefacts to counter the radiation, otherwise you're going to die a slower and more difficult death than from any bullet

This artefact is the result of genetic experimentation with mutated seeds of the 'Hvatalka' and 'Burning Feathers' plants. Toughening the skin, it offers protection from lacerations and electric shock. Not worth a lot in financial terms, but potentially useful in the field

This extremely rare artefact is also known as 'Dream Killer', due to its propensity to slow down Alpha and Beta brainwaves to the point where the effects of Psi attacks are effectively negated. Gives additional protection from the attacks of the Zone's Psi-capable creatures. Since its negative effects include a reduced rate of health recovery, use only with artefacts that compensate for this

This artefact is a mutated mushroom around which a Springboard anomaly has formed, and thus extremely rare. Forms a localised force field of a 0.3 metre radius that diffracts the path of high velocity projectiles I.e. bullets. The artefact also has a range of negative effects such as: weakening of the skin to burns, electric shock and chemicals. Due to its destructive negative properties, Stalkers usually dispose of this artefact immediately on finding one, but it would be wise to hold on to it as it seems to have a special energy about it

A mysterious artefact. There are two recorded instances of its occurrence in the Zone...
* It appeared, according to rumors, when the stalkers of the clan of 'Monolith' entered the center Zone. At the altar they preyed, asking the Monolith to gave them a sign of its existence. One night the artefact fell from heaven to earth. The fanatics took this as a sign from the monolith.
* According to scientists it was formed by the merger of several high altitude air anomalies.
A very rare item formed only in the area surrounding the Chernobyl nuclear power plant
Scientists have proclaimed this is a new and rare artefact found by a drunk Stalker near the Bar. artefact gives a small improvement in health and chemical protection but lowers bullet resistance

%c[1,1,1,1]______ %c[255,255,255,255]Radiation %c[255,255,1,1]+150\n%c[default]\nThe origin of the artefact is not known and has only been found in the Zone a few times. artefact gives good protection from impact, but reduces endurance. Radioactive

This artefact is small and looks like a set of dumbbells - and has the weight to match - 18Kg!. Incredibly strong and dense - and no means has yet been found to cut, melt or compress it. Of unknown origin, it improves health and reduces radiation. No negative properties - apart from its large mass

The exact origin of this artefact is unknown. Scientists argue that this rare artefact is formed under the influence of two anomalies - 'Springboard' and 'Electro'. The current theory is that, in the midway position between two anomalies held together by their combined electro-magnetic fields, a unique bond is formed. Artefacts created at these points have a tendency to rotate within the interacting fields. Protects from electric shock but there is a reduction in bullet resistance and immunity to radiation...

artefact, which appeared in the Zone recently. Scientists believe it is formed from Nuclear-chemosynthesis between Baryon type dark matter and the artefact 'Stone Flower'. Looks like a lump of coal. artefact gives good protection from Psionic waves and raises resistance to radioactive contamination, but with greatly increased fatigue. Make sure you have artefacts that counter the negative effects

%c[1,1,1,1]______ %c[255,255,255,255]Radiation %c[255,255,1,1]+5\n%c[default]\nartefact generated from the radiogenic nuclide of the artefact 'xZs2x4'. It protects the skin from burns and media impact. Slightly radioactive

Rarely found in the Zone and not much is known about how it is created. Provides very good protection from heat sources and attacks from Zone mutants. Explosion and strike immunities are reduced. Demand by scientists

Substance formed by the mutual co-existence of anomalies 'Fountain' and 'Fruit Punch' and Lanthanide metals. Has a number of positive attributes, and some negative. Was found recently by a Stalker nicknamed Gadget. He picked it up with no protective gloves, only just managing to get it to his backpack before his hand vaporised. On selling the artefact he was able to get a mechanical prosthetic hand

%c[1,1,1,1]______ %c[255,255,255,255]Radiation %c[255,255,1,1]+20\n%c[default]\nartefact often can be found in Radioactive areas. Increases stamina but has negative radiation attributes. The main central core is surrounded by spinning smaller mercury balls. Special gloves are recommended for handling due to its radiation and high thermal energy. Scientists have discovered that some of the artefact actually consists of of the mercury isotope Hg-194, and can be used to manufacture medicinal drugs and vaccines for a wide variety of dangerous Zone diseases

Scientists believe that this new mutation belongs to the genus family of nettles. First found by an unknown Stalker on a Surveying Expedition deep into the Zone. Synthetic hybrids have been the focus of experiments in the X-18 and X-16 laboratories. Able to reject chemical components and reduces bleeding by speeding up blood clotting

artefact formed in the anomaly 'Electro' from a variety of metal objects and alloys. The high energy states of outer valence electrons causes a localised luminescence. After detailed study, researchers found that the artefact actually produces electricity in small amounts. Using the artefact causes the skin to soften - increasing the risk of bleeding out when cut. Resistance to radioactive contamination is lowered but there is increased resistance to burns

%c[1,1,1,1]______ %c[255,255,255,255]Radiation %c[255,255,1,1]+7\n%c[default]\nScientists have been trying to unravel the mystery of this artefact. Stronger than titanium and harder than diamond but weighs less than a kilogram. Creates a slight protective field, distorting the trajectory of bullets. Adverse Effects - radioactive and reduces the resistance to impact injuries

artefact formed by the combination of three anomalies - 'The Fountain', 'Heat' and 'Fruit Punch'. Extremely rare. Scientists and researchers still do not fully understand this artefact, but it's obvious that in order to be created the fusing of the three anomalies must have released an enormous amount of energy. Using this artefact increases the body's metabolism giving greater endurance and quicker blood clotting. Higher metabolism causes higher body temperature forcing body to the skins surface and a greater vulnerability to wounds

%c[1,1,1,1]______ %c[255,255,255,255]Radiation %c[255,255,1,1]+1
%c[default]
%c[1,1,1,1 ]___%c[255,255,1,60] Longing for a real Zone Woman...100%

%c[default]An artefact of absolute beauty and wonder. Many Stalkers scour the Zone looking for this rare item - but there's only one. The presence of this artefact raises blood pressure significantly which assists in expelling chemical and radioactive agents. The drawback is that the user quickly tires. Slightly radioactive and hot to touch

Very valuable in the Zone. Sought after for the repair of circuit boards. Gold can be beaten thin enough to become translucent. Such semi-transparent sheets also strongly reflect infra-red light, making it useful as infra-red (radiant heat) shields in visors of heat-resistant suits

Discovered by a Zone Scientist years ago. He was so excited that he could not think of an appropriate name and by default it has only its Scientific designator. This extremely rare artefact will protect from the attacks of many creatures of the Zone. Its main drawback is less protection from bullets

Theoretical Physicists speculate that this artefact is the result of a micro-miniature roaming black hole captured in the Chernobyl Explosion gravity well and amalgamated with stray heavy elements under unusual particle conditions. Impossibly rare and extremely dense. Has a localised effect of bending the path fast moving projectiles away from the user - including bullets and radiation.

A bizarre artefact, with the potential to destroy your soul if used indiscriminately. Rumor has it that some meteorites from the outer rim made it to earth and seeded micro organisms in a host artefact near Chernobyl. Gives exceptional telepathic immunity while absorbing the very life force from you

Very, very rare. Rumors are that this artefact absorbs and destroys harmful energy in direct violation of conservation of energy. Unfortunately energy is also drawn from the person wearing this artefact giving them an insatiable appetite

%c[1,1,1,1]______ %c[255,255,255,255]Radiation %c[255,255,1,1]+3\n%c[default]\nElement Zero is a rare material that, when subjected to an electrical current, releases dark energy which can be manipulated into a mass effect field, raising or lowering the mass of all objects within that field. A positive current increases mass, a negative current decreases it. Zone Scientists hope to some day manipulate gravity with this rare artefact. Slightly radioactive
A true enigma of Physics. How it does it baffles the Zone Scientists but this artefact has no negative attributes and many advantages

An unusually colored and textured Mushroom. Zone rumors are that the color is due to focused high energy Ultraviolet rays. Some very rare artefacts apparently can do this and have a focal length of around 5 to 10m. A trader in the Army Warehouses may be interested in buying this Mushroom

%c[1,1,1,1]______ %c[255,255,255,255]Radiation %c[255,255,1,1]+3\n%c[default]\nFor some reason this Mushroom has very high levels of radiation. The ability of mushrooms to absorb nearby heavy metals, including those that are radioactive could be the reason behind this. Don't carry these for too long, they are slightly radioactive after all! Scientists are interested in these curiosities of the Zone

A variation of the Amanita Muscaria commonly known as the fly Agaric. Poisonous and psychoactive - an old Stalker used to brew and eat these in an attempt to negate the harmful affects of artefacts. Sid may be interested in buying these

Rare chromosphores give this Mushroom its striking light blue color - probably caused from the absorption of heavy metals like Niobium. The Blue hue was the favorite color of some guy called the 'Collector'. This Mushroom's color is highly sought after by Clear Sky traders and is used in production of their Body Armor and suits - hence the unique faction color

An irradiated mutation of the Russula Fragilis. Dangerous heavy metals have enhanced this Mushroom's striking color. These heavy metals are only found in human excrement accumulated in the body from travels deep into the Zone. Did someone leave something else around here?
Mutated Amanita Phalloides is a deadly poisonous Mushroom. Ideal to feed to your enemies. Is normally found deep in the Zone. This one must have grown from spores transferred in the soles of boots

Commonly known as the Bloody Brittlegill, is a strikingly colored mushroom. Poisonous when eaten raw. Sought after, this Mushroom is not only scarce but it contains rare heavy elements that are only found in a few small areas of the Zone. Only one 'secret' Trader in the Zone will buy this from you but you will need to find him... or her

Caesier was well-travelled and got to know the Collector quite well. Some say that the Collector passed on his knowledge of the Zonebefore he disappeared, and Caesier could well be the keeper of these secrets. The mere existence of this unique Mushroom supports this theory as the Collector was an expert in this area. Knowing how the Collector left cryptic clues all over the Zone, perhaps Caesier did the same?...\nThe Caesier Mushroom has a very hard stem which only the hardest and sharpest knives could possibly carve. Make sure you don't lose this item - it may come in handy later on
The Dark Knight was the favorite Mushroom of the Collector. If he's left this lying around, who knows what else may be nearby?
